0.title: Pest Watch – January (Wales)
items: Check overwintered brassicas for pigeons – netting recommended.
Grey mould risk in damp greenhouses or cold frames.
Slugs hiding under pots – clear debris.

1.title: Pest Watch – February (Wales)
items: Aphids may appear in mild spells on overwintering greens.
Slugs damaging salad leaves under cloches.
Mice eating stored or newly sown pea/bean seeds.

3.title: Pest Watch – April (Wales)
items: Slugs at night – traps or hand removal.

4.title: Pest Watch – May (Wales)
items: Blackfly on broad beans – pinch tips.

5.title: Pest Watch – June (Wales)
items: Potato blight risk – remove infected foliage.

6.title: Pest Watch – July (Wales)
items: Tomato blight – water at soil level.
Cabbage white caterpillars – net or hand remove.

7.title: Pest Watch – August (Wales)
items: Onion white rot – crop rotation essential.
Fruit fly near soft fruits – harvest promptly.

8.title: Pest Watch – September (Wales)
items: Grey mould on salads in damp conditions.
